channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Fall, Oil Climbs on Middle East Conflict
item.description: Major U.S. stock indexes declined and oil prices jumped after the White House said an attack by Iran on Israel was imminent.

item.title: Treasury yields remain lower as Iran launches retaliatory strikes on Israel
item.description: A flight-to-safety flow into U.S. government debt left yields broadly lower on Tuesday, as Iran launched a wave of retaliatory missile strikes on Isra...

item.title: Oil Turns Higher on Israeli Incursion Into Lebanon
item.description: Oil futures got a boost from Israel’s heightened operations in Lebanon, and worries about possible retaliation from Iran, leading to a broader and big...

item.title: Natural Gas Lower as Weather Forecast Moderates
item.description: Natural gas futures were down 0.5% with forecasts for a cooler East Coast in the near-term.

item.title: I’m in my 60s with $85,000 in credit-card debt. Should I use the equity in my home or my investments to pay it off?
item.description: “Currently, the debt gets rolled over to another 0% interest card right before the regular interest rate is about to kick in.”

item.title: Gold Gains on Middle East Escalation Fears
item.description: Gold prices gain more than 1% as risks of an all-out war in the Middle East boost safe-haven demand.

item.title: The S&P 500 is too tech-heavy. This alternative ETF keeps beating it.
item.description: The various stock indexing and weighting schemes will shine at different times, but some approaches are designed to be immune from market cycles.

item.title: Intel’s struggles hit Biden’s Chips and Science Act with a gut punch
item.description: America’s drive for semiconductor independence needs a reboot.

item.title: Shattuck Labs’ stock craters as biotech scraps main product candidate after failed trial
item.description: The stock hit a low of $1.37 earlier in the session, matching its record closing low that was set in October 2023.

item.title: Euro's Outlook Sours as Inflation Cools
item.description: The euro’s outlook looks less bright given cooling eurozone inflation, Middle East tensions and political instability in France, spreadbetting firm Ci...
